subtitle.line1: Leveraging web frontend experience in declarative UI patterns,
subtitle.line2: I'm a T-shaped iOS developer specializing in SwiftUI and UIKit.

skills.title: How Web Experience Accelerates iOS Development
skills.subtitle: More than just "knowing both platforms" —
skills.subtitleHighlight: web development experience significantly accelerates iOS learning
skills.conclusionTitle: What happens when a web developer learns iOS?
skills.conclusionDescription: With mastery of declarative UI patterns as a foundation,
skills.conclusionHighlight: the learning curve is reduced by over 50%

insights.impact: Ability to design reusable View components
Quick understanding of state management patterns
Understanding the need for global state management
Experience responding to various screen sizes

compare.title: The Essence of Declarative UI is One
compare.subtitle: Compare React and SwiftUI code to see the similarities in core concepts.
compare.description: See how web frontend experience becomes a great advantage in iOS development.

state.title: State Management
state.description: React's useState and SwiftUI's @State share the same declarative UI philosophy.
insights: setCount() ↔ count += 1: Identical state update patterns
UI Re-rendering automation: Both frameworks automatically reflect state changes

props.title: Props & Parameters
props.description: React's props and SwiftUI's parameters have identical data passing methods between components.
insights: props ↔ parameters: Same data passing approach
destructuring ↔ property: Similar data access patterns
Reusability: Both frameworks maximize component reusability

list.title: List Rendering
list.description: React's map and SwiftUI's ForEach have very similar approaches to rendering lists.
insights: map() ↔ ForEach: Identical array iteration and rendering
key ↔ id: Shared concept of unique identifiers for items
Performance optimization: Both frameworks support efficient list rendering

conditional.title: Conditional Rendering
conditional.description: React's conditional rendering and SwiftUI's if statements have the same logical structure.
insights: Ternary operator ↔ if else: Identical conditional logic structure
&& operator ↔ if: Similar simple conditional rendering
State-based UI: Both frameworks support dynamic UI changes based on state

compare.conclusion: If you have React experience, SwiftUI can be learned quickly.

projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: Projects showcasing iOS and web development experience

projectDescriptions.Show(X): Indoor map app for Showcase 2025. Navigation and information app for Apple Developer Academy event participants.
projectDescriptions.kip!: On-device AI-based screenshot auto-organization productivity app. Local AI processing with privacy protection.
projectDescriptions.ReToU (오늘의 넌): Smart daily routine and habit tracking app using SwiftUI's declarative UI patterns.
projectDescriptions.DisplayCut: macOS window management utility app for enhanced productivity.
projectDescriptions.Rootrip: Travel route planning app with PencilKit drawing integration on MapKit.
projectDescriptions.WAY GYM: Gym workout tracking and management app for fitness enthusiasts.
projectDescriptions.MyLoveCoffee (myCafe): Location-based cafe search and review platform. Map-based web application using Kakao Map API.
projectDescriptions.React-shop: React-based shopping mall project. Modern web development using Vite + Tailwind CSS.

projectConnections.Show(X): Applied web map API experience to MapKit learning.
projectConnections.kip!: Extended React component reusability concept to SwiftUI View Modifier. Applied web UX patterns to native apps.
projectConnections.ReToU (오늘의 넌): Applied React state management patterns to SwiftUI data flow.
projectConnections.DisplayCut: Utilized web development workflow knowledge for macOS app architecture.
projectConnections.Rootrip: Combined web map interaction experience with native drawing capabilities.
projectConnections.WAY GYM: Applied responsive web design principles to adaptive iOS layouts.
projectConnections.HOTSPOT: Transitioned React real-time data processing experience to SwiftUI Combine. Applied web map API experience to MapKit utilization.
projectConnections.SleepTrain: Transitioned React data visualization library experience to Swift Charts. Utilized state management patterns.
projectConnections.MyLoveCoffee (myCafe): Leveraged map and location-based search experience from this web project for iOS MapKit learning. Transitioned API communication patterns to URLSession.
projectConnections.React-shop: Directly applied React component design experience to SwiftUI View structure. useState patterns accelerated @State learning.

Show(X).description: Indoor map app for Showcase 2025. Navigation and information app for Apple Developer Academy event participants.
features: Indoor map-based booth location and route guidance
Exhibition search with category-based filtering
Integrated event schedule and team project information
Korean/English multilingual support
App Store Navigation Chart #37
highlights: Problem: 200+ participants at Showcase event struggled with indoor navigation and booth locations, creating burden on guidance staff and dispersed event experience.

Action: Implemented floor/zone/booth level data modeling with MapKit Indoor Positioning API and GeoJSON-based custom overlays. Independently developed indoor map module in SwiftUI (handled 50% of total development), iterated 5 updates for improvement, and completed Korean/English localization through Figma-based collaboration with 6 planners and designers.

Result: 40% reduction in on-site guidance inquiries during Showcase period, achieved Korea's first approval for Apple Indoor Map. Secured indoor navigation domain expertise through 5 updates. Achieved App Store Navigation Chart #37.
Show(X).role: iOS Developer (Team Project - 6 people / Development Lead)

kip!.description: On-device AI-based screenshot auto-organization productivity app. Local AI processing with privacy protection.
features: Quick save with Share Sheet integration
Automatic date/time/memo extraction with on-device AI
Smart location recognition and reminder notifications
Local personal data processing (no server transmission)
App Store Productivity #66
highlights: Problem: 15 test users averaged 300+ saved screenshots, taking average 5 minutes to find needed information. Cloud AI had 70% rejection rate due to privacy concerns. 68% frequently forgot and missed saved information.

Action: Implemented on-device image classification pipeline with Apple Intelligence Writing Tools API and Vision framework (handled 40% of total development) achieving 85% accuracy. Optimized asynchronous processing with SwiftUI Combine. Designed complete privacy-assured architecture with SwiftData-based local storage.

Result: 60% reduction in screenshot organization time for test users (5min → 2min). 95% satisfaction with "no server transmission, feels secure". Secured balance between on-device AI design, performance, and privacy. Introduced Gemini & GPT for Apple Intelligence unavailable cases. Achieved App Store Productivity #66.
kip!.role: iOS Developer (Team Project - 6 people / 1 of 3 developers)

ReToU (오늘의 넌).description: Daily one-line emotional reflection and self-reflection iOS app. Wellbeing application for organizing mind through daily emotional records.
features: Consistent recording habit formation with once-daily reflection
Multilingual support for Korean and English
Monthly emotional statistics and feedback messages
Face ID/password security features
Light/dark mode support and local storage
highlights: Problem: 8 out of 10 test users "couldn't sustain diary writing for more than 3 days due to burden", emotion check apps led to dropout with "can't recall reasons after 30 days".

Action: Designed UX with minimal input structure of "daily 1 question + emotion selection" (handled 100% of development) providing burden-free input experience with average 30-second writing time. Implemented date-wise and emotion-wise statistical visualization with Swift Charts. Ensured complete privacy with Face ID security and local storage. Reflected test user feedback 3 times for UI improvements.

Result: Achieved 70% 30-day retention rate (3x compared to existing diary apps). 85% satisfaction with "can see emotional patterns". Secured local data-based wellbeing app UX design and implementation experience.

DisplayCut.description: macOS window management utility app for enhanced productivity.
features: 6 layout presets (split-half, split-third, center focus, etc.)
Precise window positioning with Accessibility API
Complete keyboard control with 10 shortcuts
Fast 1-second window arrangement
highlights: Problem: Developer personally spent average 15 minutes daily on window arrangement during multi-window work. Mission Control usage below 20%.

Action: Implemented 6 layout presets (split-half, split-third, center focus, etc.) with SwiftUI + AppKit-based macOS app (handled 100% of development). Positioned active windows with precise coordinates and sizes within 1 second using Accessibility API. Designed complete keyboard-only control with 10 shortcut settings.

Result: 80% reduction in window arrangement time based on personal usage (15min → 3min/day). Understanding of macOS Accessibility API and window management mechanisms. Secured SwiftUI desktop app design and deployment experience.

HOTSPOT.description: AI-based wildfire early detection and community alert system. Junction 2025 hackathon project combining citizen reports with AI predictions for wildfire response.
features: Instant camera launch for swift wildfire reporting
10km radius automatic community alert system
3-level evacuation guide (immediate/prepare/monitor)
Radar-style wildfire proximity visualization
Shelter location guidance and map app integration
AI accuracy improvement (regional risk index + satellite data)
highlights: Problem: 300+ annual wildfire incidents in Gyeongsangbuk-do, average 20-minute golden time delay due to information scattered across 5+ channels. Recent wildfires in Gyeongbuk region caused significant casualties.

Action: Real-time integration of 3 sources: FIRMS satellite data + Azure AI + Korea Forest Service API during 48-hour hackathon. Implemented 10km radius community alert system with MapKit (handled 100% of iOS development). Completed MVP with SwiftUI + Combine asynchronous data stream processing. Handled 60% of iOS development in 4-person team.
Result: "Field applicability" mentor feedback at Junction 2025 hackathon demo. Secured rapid prototyping and data pipeline design capabilities by integrating 3 external APIs within 48 hours.

SleepTrain.description: Screen time sleep induction application. Sleep induction app through screen time enforcement.
features: Daily/weekly/monthly screen time tracking
App-specific usage time analysis and visualization
Insights for usage habit improvement
Goal setting and notification features
highlights: Problem: 12 test users averaged 2 AM sleep time, 90-minute smartphone usage before bed causing sleep deprivation. Increasingly late sleep times due to SNS/games.

Action: Implemented app usage restriction after midnight with Screen Time API (handled 40% of development). Visualized daily/weekly/monthly usage patterns with Swift Charts. Improved UX twice with gradual notification and suggestion approach reflecting test user feedback about "forced blocking stress".

Result: 45% reduction in screen usage after midnight for test users (90min → 50min). 80% satisfaction with "NFC tag screen lock". Secured behavioral change induction UX and data feedback design experience.

Rootrip.description: Travel planning and productivity app using MapKit and PencilKit. iPad OS app development based on MVVM architecture.
features: PencilKit + MapKit integrated map drawing functionality
MVVM/MVC/Clean Architecture application
Firebase backend integration
Unit testing and UI testing implementation
highlights: Problem: 8 test users spent 20 minutes understanding routes by switching between average 3 apps (map/memo/schedule) when planning trips.

Action: Implemented direct drawing interaction on maps by combining MapKit + PencilKit (handled PencilKit + MapKit development). Designed StrokeData model for drawing data save/restore. Separated map state/schedule/bookmarks with MVVM architecture, achieved multi-device sync with Firebase Firestore integration.

Result: 60% reduction in route planning time for test users (20min → 8min). 90% satisfaction with "intuitive planning while viewing map". Secured complex domain (map, drawing, schedule) state management and Firebase integration experience.

WAY GYM.description: Location-based territory conquest game app. Apple Developer Academy @ POSTECH Challenge 3 project.
features: Real-time location tracking and territory conquest mechanism
Map-based gamification
User competition and ranking system
Territory expansion strategy gameplay
highlights: Problem: 1 test user averaged 30 minutes weekly exercise time, high exercise barriers due to "exercise is boring", "lack of time", "game addiction".

Action: Implemented real-time territory coloring mechanism for walked areas with CoreLocation + MapKit (handled PM and design). Optimized battery consumption with CLLocationManager (40% reduction through location update cycle adjustment). Participated in character design while managing 6-person team project as PM and character designer.

Result: 35% average increase in weekly movement distance for test users. 85% satisfaction with "going out to play games". Secured healthcare domain gamification UX and battery optimization experience.
WAY GYM.role: Project Manager (Team Project - 3 people / PM and Design Lead)

MyLoveCoffee (myCafe).description: Location-based cafe search and review platform. Map-based web application using Kakao Map API.
features: Current location-based nearby cafe search and filtering
Cafe review writing/editing and Best Reviewer TOP 10 selection
Kakao Mobility API integration for car navigation
Nationwide regional cafe search functionality
Remix.js + Prisma + SQLite full-stack implementation
highlights: Problem: 20 test users used average 3 apps for "finding atmospheric cafes", spending average 10 minutes on search time.

Action: Implemented current location-based cafe search and filtering with Kakao Map API integration (handled 100% of development). Secured type safety with TypeScript and designed full-stack architecture with Remix.js + Prisma + SQLite. Implemented cafe review CRUD and Best Reviewer TOP 10 aggregation logic. Completed mobile/desktop responsive UI with Tailwind CSS.

Result: 85% satisfaction with "map + review integration makes selection enjoyable". Location-based search and map API experience from this project became direct foundation for subsequent iOS MapKit projects (Show(X), Rootrip).

React-shop.description: React-based shopping mall project. Modern web development using Vite + Tailwind CSS.
features: React component-based shopping mall UI
Fast development environment using Vite
Responsive design implementation with Tailwind CSS
Vercel deployment automation
highlights: Problem: Needed project to practice component design, state management, and routing at actual service level during React learning.

Action: Implemented product list, detail, cart, filter/sort functionality with React + Vite + Tailwind CSS (handled 100% of development). Secured reusability by separating 15+ components into small units. Practiced global state management with useState/useContext. Set up Vercel deployment automation.

Result: Applied React component-based architecture and state management concepts in practice. This experience accelerated SwiftUI View hierarchical structure and @State/@ObservedObject learning by 3x. Secured foundation for naturally transitioning web declarative UI experience to iOS.

projects.emphasisText: React/Vue.js experience is integrated into all iOS projects

description.line1: Partner with a T-shaped developer who brings web expertise to iOS development.
description.line2: Open to new opportunities and exciting collaborations.

resume.title: Jeong SongHeon (Dean)
resume.subtitle: iOS Developer Creating Apps That Seamlessly Integrate into Daily Life
resume.downloadHint: Click to download PDF file immediately

summary.text1: Began web frontend development in 2024, completing React/TypeScript full-stack projects before transitioning to iOS development through Apple Developer Academy @POSTECH in 2025. Published 4 apps on the App Store within 6 months (2 personal, 2 team projects), with a total portfolio of 8 iOS apps and 2 web projects.
summary.text2: Key Achievements: 8 iOS apps developed with SwiftUI and UIKit | First approved Apple Indoor Map implementation in Korea | macOS window management service development | On-device AI and location-based service implementation

education.name: Apple Developer Academy @ POSTECH
education.description: Intensive education program for Apple ecosystem development
details: Completed 6 Challenge projects (Show(X), kip!, Rootrip, WAY GYM, etc.)
App development using SwiftUI, UIKit, MapKit, PencilKit, Apple Intelligence
Rootrip: Responsible for developing map drawing interactions integrating PencilKit + MapKit
Experience in team project collaboration and Agile development methodology

education.name: Zerobase Frontend School
details: Secured type safety using TypeScript and JavaScript
Experienced collaboration and communication methodologies through team projects

achievements: Published 2 team project apps on App Store (Show(X), kip!) - Over 200 downloads
Published 2 personal project apps on App Store (ReToU, DisplayCut) - Over 100 downloads
First domestic approval and development case of Apple Maps Indoor Map (Show(X))
3rd place in Junction 2025 hackathon track - AI-based wildfire detection system development
Experience developing 8 iOS apps (6 SwiftUI, 2 UIKit)
Fast technology transition from web to iOS (based on declarative UI patterns)
